info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 2:52PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Berkshire and central Columbia Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 252 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Philmont, or near Chatham, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chatham, Lenox, Austerlitz, Philmont, Housatonic, Ghent, Stockbridge, Richmond, West Stockbridge, Alford, Mahkeenac Heights, Mellenville, Glendale, Red Rock, Tanglewood, North Hillsdale, Williamsville, Arnolds Mill, Harlemville and Pulvers. People attending Tanglewood should seek safe shelter immediately! MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
